summary: A 24/7/365 vitals tracking app that autonomously monitors and records an individual's health metrics continuously via the app itself, without requiring manual/external logging.
architectural_notes: App must support continuous background monitoring of vitals (24/7/365).
Vitals to track may include heart rate, blood pressure, temperature, SpO2, respiration rate.
App must autonomously measure and record vitals continuously without user-initiated manual entry — passive sensor-based or simulated continuous monitoring required.

existing_features.title: Build a live dashboard page that displays the individual's most recent vitals reading. Show each vital (heart rate, blood pressure, SpO2, temperature, respiratory rate) as a prominent metric card with its value, unit, and a status indicator (normal / warning / critical) based on clinically accepted reference ranges.

Implement a manual vitals entry form that allows the user to submit a new vitals reading at any time. The form must validate all inputs against physiologically plausible ranges before submission and display inline error messages for invalid values.

Build a historical vitals log page that displays all past readings in a scrollable table, sortable by timestamp (newest first by default). Include a date-range filter to narrow results. Additionally, render a line chart for each vital sign showing its trend over the selected time range.

Implement an in-app alert banner system that evaluates the latest vitals reading and displays a prominent dismissible alert when any vital is outside normal reference ranges. Each alert must name the specific vital, its current value, and whether the status is 'warning' or 'critical'.

Apply a clean medical-grade visual theme across the entire app: dark navy/charcoal backgrounds with crisp white and teal/green accent colors, monospaced or clinical sans-serif typography, generous whitespace, and subtle glowing metric cards. Navigation must include clearly labeled links to Dashboard, Log Entry, and History pages.

Implement a continuous autonomous vitals monitoring service on the frontend that simulates realistic in-app sensor readings (heart rate, systolic/diastolic blood pressure, SpO2, body temperature, respiratory rate) every 30 seconds and automatically submits each reading to the backend — no user interaction required.

Update the Dashboard page to reflect fully autonomous operation: remove or de-emphasize the manual log entry call-to-action, and surface the autonomous monitoring status (last auto-recorded time, next recording countdown) as a prominent live indicator.

Update the app navigation and Layout to add a monitoring status pill (e.g., '● MONITORING' in teal) visible on all pages, confirming the autonomous loop is active. The pill must pulse to indicate live activity.

new_feature_requests.summary: Continuous 24/7/365 vitals tracking for an individual
Dashboard to display real-time vitals data
Historical vitals data logging and viewing

Create a backend data model and actor to store individual vitals records. Each record must include: timestamp, heart rate (bpm), blood pressure (systolic/diastolic mmHg), blood oxygen saturation (SpO2 %), body temperature (°F/°C), and respiratory rate (breaths/min). Expose CRUD operations: addVitalsReading, getLatestReading, getReadingsByDateRange, getAllReadings.
Autonomous in-app continuous vitals monitoring: the app itself measures and records vitals automatically in the background without requiring the user to manually log readings.

Add a backend method `addSimulatedReading` (or reuse `addVitalsReading`) that accepts an auto-generated vitals record and stores it. Ensure the actor can receive readings written by the frontend's autonomous monitoring loop without any user action.
